Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is more likely that you have less than 100 utxos

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: since a utxo needs to be >100 blocks old, if you have less than 100 utxo, you will run out of eligible utxo and if the chain cant make more block, no existing utxo will become eligible

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in 100% PoS you have to spend effort to create utxo and preferably distribute to 64+ addresses

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there is a reason PoW is more realiable than PoS and the initial distribution problem with PoS is one of its weaknesses

Author: ulhaq.anwaar#2918
Content: Thanks @jl777c  this explains a lot

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with 100% PoS, the entire chain depends on the initial distribution, so you cant just put it all in one address and expect it to work, from a continue staking point but more specifically from a distribution point

Author: Alright#0419
Content: 64 utxos is enough to begin with, just don't set -pubkey on staking node, and block rewards will stake

Author: Alright#0419
Content: >64 wouldn't hurt through

Author: Alright#0419
Content: 64 UTXOs on a couple separate nodes without -pubkey not set is most reliable

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: they said they need all the mined funds to go to a -pubkey

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: so they need to set like 5000 utxo on 2 nodes ... and have a 3rd node receiving te funds

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: that isnt staking

Author: Alright#0419
Content: we need a better doc for it. I'll write up how I do it. There are plenty of ways to do it, but I've found what i do is reliable

Author: Alright#0419
Content: we could have some kind of time-out

Author: Alright#0419
Content: block hasn't happened in 2 hours? easy diff for a block

Author: Alright#0419
Content: although, that could be pretty dangerous if we aren't careful with it

Author: ulhaq.anwaar#2918
Content: when we do getblanace64  it returns mature, immature, staking and  notstaking what does each one means?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: mature means the total that is able to stake

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: immature means hte total that cannot stake

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: staking means staking, and the 64 values, are the amount in satoshies in each segid that is staking

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: not staking is what it says

Content: one pubkey per node

Author: jorian#4555
Content:
`getblockhashes`call for komodo-cli, has anyone used it before? i can't get it to work. when i read the help, it states to provide 2 timestamps as arguments, as well as a options json object: ```Arguments:
1. high         (numeric, required) The newer block timestamp
2. low          (numeric, required) The older block timestamp
3. options      (string, required) A json object
```
so i create this call: ```getblockhashes 1531440000 1531450209 '{"noOrphans":false, "logicalTimes":true}'``` but it returns: `No information available for block hashes.`

Author: jorian#4555
Content: then i switch the timestamps

Author: jorian#4555
Content: but the same result happens

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: did you enable -timestampindex=1

Author: jorian#4555
Content: that, unfortunately, is not the case and is also not shown in help

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: without timestamp indexes enabled it wont have any timestamp index info

Author: jorian#4555
Content: was it dukeleto who did all the help texts?

Author: jorian#4555
Content: should be added

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jorian what did I do?

Author: jorian#4555
Content: i don't know who made the help texts, i thought it was you

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: bitcore comes with help text for it's new RPCs, I may have touched/modified some

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: some RPCs bail out with error if the proper indexes are not enabled

Author: jorian#4555
Content: well compared with the addressindex calls, there it states `(requires addressindex to be enabled).` behind the dexcription

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it doesn't check if the index is enabled

Author: jorian#4555
Content: ok

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it should throw a more useful error, if the index is not enabled

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: patches welcome!

Author: jorian#4555
Content: heh

Author: jorian#4555
Content: i'll make an issue

Author: jorian#4555
Content: üòõ

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's 2 lines of code, you can copy from various other places

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I know you can do it üòà

Author: jorian#4555
Content: of course

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: there are various booleans, which you can do `if(!timestampIndexEnabled) { throw JSONRPCError ("you need foo index!"); }`

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's in various RPCs. And yes, a Github Issue is good too üòÉ

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that is from upstream, they didn't check either

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: A Question came up today....

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: Have there been any research papers or scientific work done to verify the efficiency/capabilities of dPoW

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in concept it is simple. checkpoints work. dPoW creates checkpoints dynamically using a stochastic process among elected notaries

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it has been field tested

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in addition to a lot of internal testing

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @FishyGuts we had free public livestreamed pentests by motivated attackers, who failed üòÉ

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i think those have even more value than academic papers, but we could use some of those too

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @FishyGuts it would be nice to verify that dpow was implemented correctly on various external coins, not all coins with dpow have been attacked since adding it. Is there funding available for writing up a paper? I haz LaTeX skillz üòÉ
